alert.note: Alert for Northern Humboldt Coast (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Coastal Flood Advisory issued December 25 at 8:33PM PST until December 26 at 12:00PM PST by NWS Eureka
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD ADVISORY NOW IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM TO NOON PST TUESDAY... * WHAT...High astronomical tides will cause minor flooding in low lying areas along Humboldt Bay. Up to one quarter foot of saltwater inundation above ground level is possible in low lying areas near shorelines and tidal waterways (Between 8.7 and 9.0 feet MLLW at the North Spit tide gauge). * WHERE...Northern Humboldt Coast County. * WHEN...From 9 AM to noon PST Tuesday.. . * IMPACTS...These tides will likely impact Jackson Ranch Road in the Arcata Bottoms and low lying roads in King Salmon.
info.instruction: A Coastal Flood Advisory indicates that onshore winds and tides will combine to generate flooding of low areas along the shore. Feet Above Ground is locally defined as feet above the Highest Astronomical Tide or HAT.
